contentrichtext.text: {{otherships|HMAS Australia}} {|{{Infobox Ship Begin}} {{Infobox Ship Image |Ship image=[[File:HMS Australia (1886) in the 1890s.jpg|300px]] |Ship caption= }} {{Infobox Ship Career |Hide header= |Ship country= |Ship flag=[[Image:Naval Ensign of the United Kingdom.svg|60px|Royal Navy Ensign]] |Ship class= |Ship name=HMS ''Australia'' |Ship ordered= |Ship awarded= |Ship builder= Robert Napier & Sons, [[Govan]]<ref>[http://www.clydesite.co.uk/clydebuilt/viewship.asp?id=8697 Clydbuilt Database]</ref> |Ship laid down=21 April 1885 |Ship launched=25 November 1886 |Ship christened= |Ship acquired= |Ship commissioned= |Ship recommissioned= |Ship decommissioned= |Ship in service= |Ship out of service= |Ship renamed= |Ship reclassified= |Ship refit= |Ship captured= |Ship struck= |Ship reinstated= |Ship fate=Sold for breaking up 4 April 1905 |Ship status= |Ship homeport= }} {{Infobox Ship Characteristics |Hide header= |Header caption= |Ship displacement=5,600 tons |Ship tons burthen= |Ship length={{convert|300|ft|m|abbr=on}} |Ship beam={{convert|56|ft|m|abbr=on}} |Ship draught={{convert|22.5|ft|m|abbr=on}} |Ship draft= |Ship propulsion=3-cylinder triple-extension steam engines<br>two shafts<br>4 double-ended boilers<br>5,500 hp<br> 8,500 hp forced-draught |Ship speed={{convert|17|kn|km/h|abbr=on}} natural draught<br>{{convert|18|kn|km/h|abbr=on}} forced draught |Ship range=10,000 nautical miles (19,000 km) at 10 knots (19 km/h) |Ship endurance= |Ship test depth= |Ship boats= |Ship capacity= |Ship complement=484 |Ship time to activate= |Ship sensors= |Ship EW= |Ship armament=2 × [[BL 9.2 inch gun Mk III - VII|BL {{convert|9.2|in|mm|sing=on|sigfig=4}} Mk V guns]]<br>10 x [[BL 6 inch gun Mk III IV VI|BL {{convert|6|in|mm|sing=on|sigfig=4}} guns]] (10 x 1)<br>6 × 6 pdr guns (6 × 1) QF<br>10 × 3 pdr guns (10 × 1) QF<br>6 × 18 in (457 mm) [[torpedo tube]]s:<br>4 above-water broadside<br>1 bow and 1 stern submerged |Ship armour=10 in (254 mm) belt<br>12 in (304.8 mm) conning tower |Ship armor= |Ship aircraft= |Ship motto= |Ship nickname= |Ship honours= |Ship notes= }} |} '''HMS ''Australia''''' was an [[Orlando class cruiser|''Orlando''-class]] [[cruiser]] of the [[Royal Navy]] completed in 1888 and named after the colonies (later to be nation) of [[Australia]]. She was scrapped at [[Troon]] in 1905. During her time in service, future Vice Admiral [[Charles Royds]] served aboard her. The only other warships to be named ''Australia'' have belonged to the [[Royal Australian Navy]]. ==References== *{{Colledge}} * Roger Chesneau and Eugene M. Kolesnik, ed., ''Conway's All The Worlds Fighting Ships, 1860-1905'', (Conway Maritime Press, London, 1979), ISBN 0-85177-133-5 *{{Reflist}} {{Orlando class cruiser}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Australia}} [[Category:Orlando-class cruisers]] [[Category:1886 ships]] {{UK-mil-ship-stub}}
